attempts.raw_output:
Complete the following Lean 4 code:
```lean4
import Mathlib

open Nat Topology Filter

/--
Let $\hexagon ABCDEF$ be a hexagon inscribed in a circle of radius $r$. If $AB = CD = EF = r$, prove that the midpoints of $\overline{BC}$, $\overline{DE}$, and $\overline{FA}$ form the vertices of an equilateral triangle.
-/
theorem putnam_1967_b1
(r : ℝ)
(L : ZMod 6 → (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)))
(P Q R: EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))
(hP : P = midpoint ℝ (L 1) (L 2))
(hQ : Q = midpoint ℝ (L 3) (L 4))
(hR : R = midpoint ℝ (L 5) (L 0))
(hr : r > 0)
(hcyclic : ∃ (O : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)), ∀ i : ZMod 6, dist O (L i) = r)
(horder : ∀ i j : ZMod 6, i ≠ j → i + 1 = j ∨ i = j + 1 ∨ segment ℝ (L i) (L j) ∩ interior (convexHull ℝ {L k | k : ZMod 6}) ≠ ∅)
(hlens : dist (L 0) (L 1) = r ∧ dist (L 2) (L 3) = r ∧ dist (L 4) (L 5) = r)
(hdist : L 1 ≠ L 2 ∧ L 3 ≠ L 4 ∧ L 5 ≠ L 0)
: dist P Q = dist R P ∧ dist Q R = dist P Q :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1967_b1
(r : ℝ)
(L : ZMod 6 → (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)))
(P Q R: EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))
(hP : P = midpoint ℝ (L 1) (L 2))
(hQ : Q = midpoint ℝ (L 3) (L 4))
(hR : R = midpoint ℝ (L 5) (L 0))
(hr : r > 0)
(hcyclic : ∃ (O : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)), ∀ i : ZMod 6, dist O (L i) = r)
(horder : ∀ i j : ZMod 6, i ≠ j → i + 1 = j ∨ i = j + 1 ∨ segment ℝ (L i) (L j) ∩ interior (convexHull ℝ {L k | k : ZMod 6}) ≠ ∅)
(hlens : dist (L 0) (L 1) = r ∧ dist (L 2) (L 3) = r ∧ dist (L 4) (L 5) = r)
(hdist : L 1 ≠ L 2 ∧ L 3 ≠ L 4 ∧ L 5 ≠ L 0)
: dist P Q = dist R P ∧ dist Q R = dist P Q := by
  have h₁ := hcyclic
  rcases hcyclic with ⟨O, hO⟩
  have h₂ := horder 0 1
  have h₃ := horder 2 3
  have h₄ := horder 4 5
  have h₅ := horder 1 2
  have h₆ := horder 3 4
  have h₇ := horder 5 0
  simp at h₂ h₃ h₄ h₅ h₆ h₇
  norm_num at h₂ h₃ h₄ h₅ h₆ h₇
  norm_num [hP, hQ, hR, midpoint_eq_iff] at *
  <;>
  (try ring_nf at * ) <;>
  (try norm_num at * ) <;>
  (try simp_all [dist_eq_norm]) <;>
  (try norm_num) <;>
  (try linarith) <;>
  (try aesop)
  <;>
  (try nlinarith)
  <;>
  (try aesop)
```

```lean4
theorem putnam_1967_b1
(r : ℝ)
(L : ZMod 6 → (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)))
(P Q R: EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))
(hP : P = midpoint ℝ (L 1) (L 2))
(hQ : Q = midpoint ℝ (L 3) (L 4))
(hR : R = midpoint ℝ (L 5) (L 0))
(hr : r > 0)
(hcyclic : ∃ (O : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)), ∀ i : ZMod 6, dist O (L i) = r)
(horder : ∀ i j : ZMod 6, i ≠ j → i + 1 = j ∨ i = j + 1 ∨ segment ℝ (L i) (L j) ∩ interior (convexHull ℝ {L k | k : ZMod 6}) ≠ ∅)
(hlens : dist (L 0) (L 1) = r ∧ dist (L 2) (L 3) = r ∧ dist (L 4) (L 5) = r)
(hdist : L 1 ≠ L 2 ∧ L 3 ≠ L 4 ∧ L 5 ≠ L 0)
: dist P Q = dist R P ∧ dist Q R = dist P Q := by
  have h1 := hcyclic
  rcases h1 with ⟨O, hO⟩
  have h2 := horder 0 1
  have h3 := horder 2 3
  have h4 := horder 4 5
  have h5 := horder 1 2
  have h6 := horder 3 4
  have h7 := horder 5 0
  simp at h2 h3 h4 h5 h6 h7
  norm_num at h2 h3 h4 h5 h6 h7
  <;>
  (try simp_all [hP, hQ, hR, hlen, hdist, dist_eq_norm, norm_eq_abs, abs_sub_comm])
  <;>
  (try ring_nf)
  <;>
  (try field_simp [hr.ne', Real.dist_0_eq_abs])
  <;>
  (try norm_num)
  <;>
  (try linarith)
  <;>
  (try nlinarith)
  <;>
  (try aesop)

theorem putnam_1967_b1
(r : ℝ)
(L : ZMod 6 → (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)))
(P Q R: EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))
(hP : P = midpoint ℝ (L 1) (L 2))
(hQ : Q = midpoint ℝ (L 3) (L 4))
(hR : R = midpoint ℝ (L 5) (L 0))
(hr : r > 0)
(hcyclic : ∃ (O : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)), ∀ i : ZMod 6, dist O (L i) = r)
(horder : ∀ i j : ZMod 6, i ≠ j → i + 1 = j ∨ i = j + 1 ∨ segment ℝ (L i) (L j) ∩ interior (convexHull ℝ {L k | k : ZMod 6}) ≠ ∅)
(hlens : dist (L 0) (L 1) = r ∧ dist (L 2) (L 3) = r ∧ dist (L 4) (L 5) = r)

  have h₂ := horder 0 1
  have h₃ := horder 1 2

  have h₅ := horder 3 4
  have h₆ := horder 4 5
  have h₇ := horder 5 0

```lean4
theorem putnam_1967_b1
(r : ℝ)
(L : ZMod 6 → (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)))
(P Q R: EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))
(hP : P = midpoint ℝ (L 1) (L 2))
(hQ : Q = midpoint ℝ (L 3) (L 4))
(hR : R = midpoint ℝ (L 5) (L 0))
(hr : r > 0)
(hcyclic : ∃ (O : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)), ∀ i : ZMod 6, dist O (L i) = r)
(horder : ∀ i j : ZMod 6, i ≠ j → i + 1 = j ∨ i = j + 1 ∨ segment ℝ (L i) (L j) ∩ interior (convexHull ℝ {L k | k : ZMod 6}) ≠ ∅)
(hlens : dist (L 0) (L 1) = r ∧ dist (L 2) (L 3) = r ∧ dist (L 4) (L 5) = r)
(hdist : L 1 ≠ L 2 ∧ L 3 ≠ L 4 ∧ L 5 ≠ L 0)
: dist P Q = dist R P ∧ dist Q R = dist P Q := by
  have h1 := hcyclic
  rcases h1 with ⟨O, hO⟩
  have h2 := horder 0 1
  have h3 := horder 1 2
  have h4 := horder 2 3
  have h5 := horder 3 4
  have h6 := horder 4 5
  have h7 := horder 5 0
  simp at h2 h3 h4 h5 h6 h7
  norm_num [hP, hQ, hR, hlen, hdist] at *
  <;>
  (try ring_nf at * ) <;>
  (try norm_num at * ) <;>
  (try aesop)
```

(r : ℝ)
(L : ZMod 6 → (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)))
(P Q R: EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))

theorem putnam_1967_b1
(r : ℝ)
(L : ZMod 6 → (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)))
(P Q R: EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))
(hP : P = midpoint ℝ (L 1) (L 2))
(hQ : Q = midpoint ℝ (L 3) (L 4))
(hR : R = midpoint ℝ (L 5) (L 0))
